title: Milos Zeman: The Czech leader proud to be politically incorrect
description: Ailing Czech President Milos Zeman is famously fond of liquor and provocative jokes.

title: Jammu and Kashmir: Killing of civilians sparks militancy fear
description: People, especially religious minorities, now fear for their safety in Indian-administered Kashmir.

title: Africa's iconic architecture in 12 buildings
description: Two architects are determined to showcase the architecture of Africa to the world - past and present.

title: Escaping the Taliban: Afghan policeman's struggle to enter Turkey
description: Former soldiers and police are among Afghans trying to evade a crackdown at the Turkey-Iran border.

title: Rising up against racism: London's forgotten Bangladeshi squatters
description: Hundreds of Bangaldeshis took over empty properties in London in the 1970s, demanding better housing.

title: Andrew Watson: The 'most influential' black footballer for decades lost to history
description: Andrew Watson was a trailblazer who helped shape how football is played today. For decades he was lost to history.

title: Why does the internet keep breaking?
description: Outages of Facebook and its family of apps now lead to significant disruption for firms worldwide

title: England boss Southgate 'commits crime' every time he picks team
description: England boss Gareth Southgate says he "commits a crime" every time he picks a team because of the players he has to leave out - and will make changes for Tuesday's match with Hungary.

title: Black scientists say UK research is institutionally racist
description: Senior black scientists tell the BBC they believe UK science to be "institutionally racist".

title: 24-hour pub crawl: St Neots man 'sets new world record'
description: Matt Ellis is waiting for Guinness World Records to verify his feat, which began in Cambridge.

title: UK cyber head says Russia responsible for 'devastating' ransomware attacks
description: UK security agencies say most of these attacks on the UK come from cyber-criminals in Russia.

title: What are the accusations against Prince Andrew?
description: Here's what you need to know about the sex abuse claims being pursued by Virginia Giuffre in the US.

title: NFL: Tom Brady, Josh Allen & Laviska Shenault lead plays of the week
description: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen's hurdle, Tom Brady's cool head and Laviska Shenault breaking four tackles feature in week five of NFL plays of the week.

title: Why X Factor's Grace Davies has taken four years to release Roots
description: X Factor runner-up Grace Davies has finally put out the song that got her noticed back in 2017.

title: Pregnant women urged to get Covid vaccine by NHS England
description: NHS England says the number of pregnant women seriously ill in critical care with the virus has grown.

title: Nobel economics prize awarded for real-life studies
description: David Card, Joshua D Angrist and Guido W Imbens share the prestigious economics prize.

title: Injured striker Adams misses out for Scotland in Faroes
description: Southampton striker Che Adams will miss Scotland's World Cup qualifier against Faroe Islands on Tuesday, the Scottish FA confirms.

title: Police face hundreds of sexual assault complaints
description: At least 750 allegations were made against serving officers across Britain over five years.

title: Asos boss exits as firm warns profits to plunge
description: "Normalised" levels of clothing returns are set to hit the online fashion giant's profits.

title: Firms call for help over surging gas prices
description: The government will hold talks with industry amid fears some factories may be forced to close.

title: Mass protests in Poland amid EU exit fears
description: The nationwide protests come after Poland's top court challenged the supremacy of EU rules.

title: Red Bull's Christian Horner questions Mercedes speed gains
description: Red Bull's Christian Horner expresses his "surprise" at gains he says Mercedes have made with their engine performance.

title: Sir Richard Sutton: Thomas Schreiber admits killing millionaire
description: Thomas Schreiber denies murdering one of UK's richest men, Sir Richard Sutton, in Dorset.

title: Paul Merson on gambling addiction: 'I wouldn't wish this on anybody'
description: In a new film coming to BBC One, former England footballer Paul Merson investigates his addiction to gambling.

title: Paul McCartney says John Lennon 'instigated' the Beatles' break-up
description: "It was John who wanted a divorce," he says, setting the record straight on the band's break-up.

title: Malaria vaccine 'will change African lives forever'
description: As African countries get the vaccine, Newsbeat speaks to two people who've grown up with Malaria.

title: Epstein: Met to take no action after Prince Andrew review
description: Virginia Giuffre is suing the duke in the US for allegedly sexually assaulting her as a teenager.

title: Prince Charles: I understand climate activists' anger
description: The Prince of Wales tells the BBC he sympathises with protesters - but any action must be constructive.

title: Murray beats teenager Alcaraz to reach Indian Wells third round
description: Andy Murray beats highly-rated Spanish teenager Carlos Alcaraz 5-7 6-3 6-2 to reach the third round at Indian Wells.

title: 'I'm an openly gay man in football' - EFL referee Adcock shares his story on National Coming Out Day
description: To mark National Coming Out Day, EFL referee James Adcock speaks publicly for the first time about his sexuality.

title: Prince Charles: My Aston Martin runs on wine and cheese
description: Ahead of COP26, Prince Charles speaks to the BBC about his personal action and decades of campaigning.

title: Marcus Rashford: Manchester United and England striker says support after racist abuse was a 'special moment'
description: Marcus Rashford says the support he received after being targeted with racist abuse following the Euro 2020 final was a "special moment" for him.

title: The Papers: 'Gas price clash', and NHS staff face waiting list 'abuse'
description: The energy crisis facing the UK continues to feature prominently on the front pages.

title: Periods and low confidence put some girls off sport
description: The Youth Sports Trust charity wants girls to have a greater say over PE in schools.
